|rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = |rad1cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== ===Features=== *Providing 4x 10/100 Base-T Ethernet interface *Supporting Bridge and Router mode *High reliability, simple operation and low power consumption *ITU-T G.992.1/ G.992.3/ G.992.5 ADSL/ADSL2/ADS2+ *ITU-T G.993.2 VDSL2 standard This device have many good functions, such as 802,1q, L2 management switch :and VDSL2 support up to 100Mbit/s downstream to 60Mbit/s Upstream. :Device based on broadcom BCM6368 V3.1 chip. ===== Hardware Highlights ===== {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! SoC ! Ram ! Flash ! Ethernet ! Wireless ! Modem ! USB ! Serial ! JTag |- | Broadcom
BCM6368U
@400MHz | 64 MiB | 4 MiB | 4 x 100 | Broadcom
BCM4318
802.11a/b/g | xDSL | No | Yes | ? |- |} ==Links of Interest== *[http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/zte/zxdsl_931wii_v1 ''ZTE ZXDSL 931WII V1'' on '''OpenWrt''' wiki] ===Forum threads=== *[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=34211 On '''OpenWrt''' forums] *[https://amazingdiy.wordpress.com/2011/06/06/zxdsl-931wii-hacking/ ''ZXDSL 931WII'' hacking on '''AmazingDIY'''] :How to connect to the Serial Port of this specific device. ===== Buttons ===== The ZTE ZXDSL 931WII has four buttons. They are Power ON/OFF,WPS,Reset and WLAN ON/OFF. ===== Photos ===== [http://www.pakitong.com/2013/03/tm-unifi-zte-zxdsl-931dii-vdsl-modem.html Photos ZXDSL 931WII] ==Pictures==
